properties.headline: Hard Freeze Warning issued February 3 at 12:59PM PST until February 5 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Tonight, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 16 degrees.
For Tuesday night, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 18 degrees
possible.

* WHERE...Apple and Lucerne Valleys. Coldest temperatures along and
west of Highway 247.

* WHEN...From 10 PM PST this evening through Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other
sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor
plumbing.
properties.instruction:
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing.

NWSheadline: HARD FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY
